problem_text:
Does there exist a subgroup-closed saturated formation F of finite groups properly contained in Eπ, where π = char(F), satisfying the following property: if G ∈ F, then there exists a prime p (depending on the group G) such that the wreath product C_p ≀ G belongs to F, where C_p is the cyclic group of order p?
A. Ballester-Bolinches
answer: Yes, there does (S. F. Kamornikov, Trudy. Inst. Mat. (Minsk), 24, no. 1 (2016), 30–33).
